title: Generate a Netlify-ready frontend ZIP for manual upload

requirements.text: Provide a Netlify-ready frontend export ZIP at `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` by running the existing Netlify export workflow so the user can manually upload it to Netlify.
acceptanceCriteria: After running the export workflow, the file `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` exists in the repository workspace.
The ZIP contains the built site at the ZIP root (i.e., `index.html` is at the root of the ZIP, not nested under a `dist/` folder).
The ZIP includes the critical Netlify/SEO files: `index.html`, `googlecdab296682a0e0eb.html`, and `_redirects`.
If the export workflow fails (missing critical files or failing Google verification meta tag check), it exits with a non-zero code and prints an actionable error message.

requirements.text: Update `frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` to include the missing one-command export instruction (including the exact command to run from the `frontend` directory) and the manual Netlify upload steps for deploying `frontend/netlify-dist.zip`.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` contains a complete, copy-pasteable command that generates `frontend/netlify-dist.zip` when run from the `frontend` directory.
`frontend/NETLIFY_DEPLOY.md` includes concise steps for Netlify manual deploy (Add new site → Deploy manually → upload `netlify-dist.zip`).

constraints: Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; do not introduce additional backend services.

Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose instead of editing).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding new product features to the app UI.
Changing site content, branding, routing behavior, or SEO strategy beyond what is required for the ZIP export and documentation.
Adding or modifying backend canister logic (not needed for a static Netlify deploy ZIP).
